data.title: S3 Bucket Publicly Accessible
data.description: S3 bucket 'insureco-customer-documents' has public read access enabled via bucket ACL. This bucket contains customer policy documents and personal information.
data.remediation: Remove public access by updating bucket ACL and enabling Block Public Access settings

data.title: Overly Permissive IAM Role
data.description: IAM role 'insureco-web-app-role' has wildcard permissions (s3:*) allowing unrestricted S3 access. This violates principle of least privilege.
data.remediation: Restrict IAM policy to specific S3 actions (GetObject, PutObject) and specific bucket ARNs

data.title: RDS Instance Not Encrypted
data.description: RDS PostgreSQL instance 'insureco-prod-db' does not have encryption at rest enabled. Database contains customer PII and payment information.
data.remediation: Enable encryption at rest using AWS KMS. Note: Requires creating encrypted snapshot and restoring to new instance.

data.title: Security Group Allows Unrestricted SSH Access
data.description: Security group allows SSH access (port 22) from 0.0.0.0/0. This increases attack surface for brute force attacks.
data.remediation: Restrict SSH access to specific IP ranges or use AWS Systems Manager Session Manager

data.title: CloudTrail Log File Validation Not Enabled
data.description: CloudTrail trail 'insureco-cloudtrail' does not have log file validation enabled, preventing detection of log tampering.
data.remediation: Enable log file validation in CloudTrail trail configuration

findings.description: Apache Log4j2 2.0-beta9 through 2.15.0 JNDI features used in configuration, log messages, and parameters do not protect against attacker controlled LDAP and other JNDI related endpoints. An attacker who can control log messages or log message parameters can execute arbitrary code loaded from LDAP servers when message lookup substitution is enabled.
The BN_mod_sqrt() function, which computes a modular square root, contains a bug that can cause it to loop forever for non-prime moduli.

findings.message: SQL injection vulnerability detected in policy search endpoint. User input is directly concatenated into SQL query without parameterization.
Hardcoded credentials detected. API key is stored directly in source code.
Weak password validation allows passwords shorter than 8 characters.
Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability. User input is rendered without sanitization.
Server certificate validation is disabled, allowing man-in-the-middle attacks.
OS command injection vulnerability. User input is passed to Runtime.exec() without validation.

findings.title: S3 Bucket Publicly Accessible
findings.description: S3 bucket 'insureco-customer-documents' has public read access enabled via bucket ACL. This bucket contains customer policy documents and personal information.
findings.remediation: Remove public access by updating bucket ACL and enabling Block Public Access settings

findings.title: Overly Permissive IAM Role
findings.description: IAM role 'insureco-web-app-role' has wildcard permissions (s3:*) allowing unrestricted S3 access. This violates principle of least privilege.
findings.remediation: Restrict IAM policy to specific S3 actions (GetObject, PutObject) and specific bucket ARNs

findings.title: RDS Instance Not Encrypted
findings.description: RDS PostgreSQL instance 'insureco-prod-db' does not have encryption at rest enabled. Database contains customer PII and payment information.
findings.remediation: Enable encryption at rest using AWS KMS. Note: Requires creating encrypted snapshot and restoring to new instance.

findings.title: Security Group Allows Unrestricted SSH Access
findings.description: Security group allows SSH access (port 22) from 0.0.0.0/0. This increases attack surface for brute force attacks.
findings.remediation: Restrict SSH access to specific IP ranges or use AWS Systems Manager Session Manager

findings.title: CloudTrail Log File Validation Not Enabled
findings.description: CloudTrail trail 'insureco-cloudtrail' does not have log file validation enabled, preventing detection of log tampering.
findings.remediation: Enable log file validation in CloudTrail trail configuration

threats.threat_description: SSRF vulnerability in image proxy allowing internal network scanning
Misconfigured Kong route exposing internal APIs to partners
Typosquatted npm package 'reqeusts' instead of 'requests' in dependencies
Secrets and API keys committed to Git history
XML External Entity (XXE) injection in partner data parser
Kong admin API exposed without authentication

data.title: Kong Admin API Exposed Without Authentication
data.description: Kong Admin API is accessible from the internet without authentication on port 8001. This allows unauthorized users to modify gateway configuration, add routes, and access sensitive data.
data.remediation: Enable authentication on Admin API using key-auth or RBAC plugin, or restrict access to internal network only

data.title: Internal API Route Exposed to Partners
data.description: Kong route '/internal/admin' is configured to forward requests to internal admin API but is accessible from partner network. This route should only be accessible from internal network.
data.remediation: Add IP restriction plugin to limit access to internal network ranges only

data.title: Rate Limiting Not Configured
data.description: Partner API routes do not have rate limiting configured, allowing potential abuse and denial of service attacks.
data.remediation: Configure rate-limiting plugin with appropriate limits (e.g., 1000 requests per hour per consumer)

data.title: Missing Request Size Limit
data.description: Webhook endpoint does not have request size limit configured, allowing potential memory exhaustion attacks.
data.remediation: Configure request-size-limiting plugin with maximum payload size (e.g., 10MB)

data.title: Container Running as Root User
data.description: Container 'b2b-quotes-app' is configured to run as root user (UID 0). This violates PCI-DSS requirements and increases blast radius if container is compromised.
data.remediation: Set securityContext.runAsNonRoot: true and securityContext.runAsUser to non-zero UID in deployment manifest

data.title: Excessive Kubernetes RBAC Permissions
data.description: ServiceAccount 'quote-engine-sa' has cluster-admin ClusterRoleBinding, granting full cluster access. This violates principle of least privilege.
data.remediation: Create custom Role with minimal required permissions and bind to ServiceAccount

data.title: Database Node Exposed to Internet
data.description: PostgreSQL database node is accessible from internet via public IP address. Database contains customer PII and payment card data.
data.remediation: Remove public IP address and configure access through private subnet only

data.title: Pod Security Policy Not Enforced
data.description: Kubernetes cluster does not have PodSecurityPolicy enabled, allowing privileged containers and host access.
data.remediation: Enable PodSecurityPolicy admission controller and create restrictive policies

data.title: Secrets Stored in ConfigMaps
data.description: Database credentials and API keys stored in ConfigMaps instead of Secrets. ConfigMaps are not encrypted at rest.
data.remediation: Move sensitive data to Kubernetes Secrets and enable encryption at rest

data.title: Linux Kernel Netfilter Use-After-Free (CVE-2023-32233)
data.description: The remote host is running a version of Linux kernel affected by a use-after-free vulnerability in Netfilter nf_tables. An attacker can exploit this to gain root privileges.
data.remediation: Upgrade Linux kernel to version 5.15.0-73 or later

data.title: glibc Buffer Overflow (Looney Tunables - CVE-2023-4911)
data.description: The remote host has a version of glibc affected by a buffer overflow vulnerability that can be exploited for privilege escalation.
data.remediation: Upgrade glibc to version 2.31-0ubuntu9.12 or later

data.title: OpenSSL X.509 Email Address Buffer Overflow (CVE-2022-3602)
data.description: The remote host has a version of OpenSSL affected by a buffer overflow vulnerability in X.509 certificate verification.
data.remediation: Upgrade OpenSSL to version 1.1.1s or later

data.title: Runtime SQL Injection Attack Detected
data.description: Contrast RASP detected and blocked a SQL injection attack attempt at runtime. Attacker attempted to inject malicious SQL through quote description parameter.

data.title: Runtime Command Injection Attempt
data.description: Contrast RASP detected command injection attempt through file upload functionality.

findings.description: Use-after-free vulnerability in Netfilter nf_tables when processing batch requests can be abused to perform arbitrary read and write operations on kernel memory.
PostgreSQL JDBC Driver allows attacker to inject SQL if using PreferQueryMode=SIMPLE.
X.509 Email Address Buffer Overflow in OpenSSL.
Buffer overflow in the dynamic loader's processing of the GLIBC_TUNABLES environment variable (Looney Tunables).

findings.title: Container Running as Root User
findings.description: Container 'b2b-quotes-app' is configured to run as root user (UID 0). This violates PCI-DSS requirements and increases blast radius if container is compromised.
findings.remediation: Set securityContext.runAsNonRoot: true and securityContext.runAsUser to non-zero UID in deployment manifest

findings.title: Excessive Kubernetes RBAC Permissions
findings.description: ServiceAccount 'quote-engine-sa' has cluster-admin ClusterRoleBinding, granting full cluster access. This violates principle of least privilege.
findings.remediation: Create custom Role with minimal required permissions and bind to ServiceAccount

findings.title: Database Node Exposed to Internet
findings.description: PostgreSQL database node is accessible from internet via public IP address. Database contains customer PII and payment card data.
findings.remediation: Remove public IP address and configure access through private subnet only

findings.title: Pod Security Policy Not Enforced
findings.description: Kubernetes cluster does not have PodSecurityPolicy enabled, allowing privileged containers and host access.
findings.remediation: Enable PodSecurityPolicy admission controller and create restrictive policies

findings.title: Secrets Stored in ConfigMaps
findings.description: Database credentials and API keys stored in ConfigMaps instead of Secrets. ConfigMaps are not encrypted at rest.
findings.remediation: Move sensitive data to Kubernetes Secrets and enable encryption at rest

data.title: Arbitrary Code Execution in Apache Commons Text (Text4Shell)
data.description: Apache Commons Text 1.5 through 1.9 is vulnerable to remote code execution via variable interpolation. An attacker can execute arbitrary code by crafting malicious input that triggers script execution.
data.remediation: Upgrade flink-streaming-java to version that uses commons-text 1.10.0 or later

data.title: Denial of Service in Jackson Databind
data.description: Jackson-databind is vulnerable to denial of service via deeply nested objects causing stack overflow.
data.remediation: Upgrade jackson-databind to 2.13.4.1 or later

data.title: HTTP Request Smuggling in Netty
data.description: Netty is vulnerable to HTTP request smuggling attacks due to improper handling of Transfer-Encoding headers.
data.remediation: Upgrade netty to 4.1.86.Final or later

data.title: Azure Storage Account Key Exposed
data.description: Azure Storage account access key is exposed in application configuration. This key provides full access to all blobs, files, queues, and tables in the storage account containing customer event data.
data.remediation: Rotate storage account keys immediately, use Azure Key Vault for secret management, and implement Managed Identity for authentication

data.title: Network Security Group Allows Unrestricted Kafka Access
data.description: Network Security Group allows inbound traffic to Kafka brokers (port 9092) from any source (0.0.0.0/0). This exposes Kafka cluster to internet-based attacks.
data.remediation: Restrict NSG rules to allow Kafka access only from authorized IP ranges or VNets

data.title: Kafka Topic Without Authentication
data.description: Kafka topic 'customer-events' is configured with PLAINTEXT protocol without SASL authentication. Any client can connect and consume sensitive customer event data.
data.remediation: Enable SASL/SCRAM or SASL/PLAIN authentication on Kafka brokers and configure ACLs for topic access

data.title: Kafka Encryption at Rest Not Enabled
data.description: Kafka topics containing sensitive customer data do not have encryption at rest enabled. Data is stored in plaintext on broker disks.
data.remediation: Enable encryption at rest for Kafka log segments using Azure Disk Encryption or Kafka native encryption

data.title: Schema Registry API Without Authentication
data.description: Confluent Schema Registry API is accessible without authentication, allowing unauthorized users to view and modify schemas.
data.remediation: Enable authentication on Schema Registry using basic auth or RBAC

findings.description: Apache Commons Text performs variable interpolation, allowing an attacker to execute arbitrary code via crafted input (Text4Shell).
Jackson-databind allows a Java StackOverflow exception and denial of service via a large depth of nested objects.
Netty project suffers from a potential HTTP request smuggling vulnerability.
